poem:
Title: The Lesson We Fail to Learn

In the dappled shade of the classroom's edge,
A desperate tale is etched in chalk.
Words of worry, scrawled on the minds of mentors,
23% drowned in alcohol's deceptive solace,
12% in the storm of their own despair.
Charted in red ink, this silent epidemic,
Begs for lifeboats in halls of parchment.
Irony, isn't it? They teach survival, yet how do they survive?
